prop.head.headtext: Confidential Business Information and the Employment Relationship

para.paratext: Although often overlooked by both employers and employees, employees have a duty to provide reasonable notice of resignation to their employers. Generally, the more senior an employee is, the longer the required period of reasonable notice of departure. For almost all junior and lower level employees, reasonable notice will be expected to be two weeks. The law usually sets an expected length of notice of resignation that is commensurate with the degree of responsibility of the employee's position. The primary purpose of such notice is to allow a diligent employer enough time to replace the employee without jeopardizing its business interests and relationships. Specifically, the employer must be able to find and train a replacement employee, as well as ensure that its customer relationships and employee situation are solidified.
